text: Ceratozamia hildae, commonly known as the bamboo cycad, is a species of cycad in the family Zamiaceae that is endemic to Mexico. It is native to the Huasteca Potosina of Querétaro and San Luis Potosí, near the Santa Maria River. C. hildae inhabits deciduous oak woodlands at elevations of . It is threatened by habitat loss and over-collecting. ==References== ==External links== * * hildae Category:Endemic flora of Mexico Category:Flora of Querétaro Category:Flora of San Luis Potosí Category:Endangered biota of Mexico Category:Endangered plants Category:Plants described in 1979 Category:Taxonomy articles created by Polbot
title: Ceratozamia hildae
